entry.p: I just found this essay on "unschooling". I especially like this sentence:

blockquote.p: The traditional curriculum is based on the assumption that children must be pursued by knowledge because they will never pursue it themselves.

entry.p: School and I never got along, and I always learned more outside of school (reading, working, playing music, etc.) than I ever did in the structured world of classes and quizzes. I think I've always been an unschooler, but I never knew it until now.
